Package components.inventory

Interface Inventory

All Superinterfaces:
InventoryKernel, Iterable<Inventory.Item>, components.standard.Standard<Inventory>
All Known Implementing Classes:
Inventory1, InventorySecondary
public interface Inventory extends InventoryKernel
InventoryKernel enhanced with secondary methods.

    • getItem

      Inventory.Item getItem(int slot)
      Returns the Item at slot in this.
      Parameters:
      slot - the slot to get the Item from
      Returns:
      the Item at slot

    • copyItem

      void copyItem(Inventory src, String name, int destSlot)
      Adds a copy of an Item in another Inventory to this.
      Parameters:
      src - the source Inventory
      name - the slot to get the Item from
      destSlot - where to place the copied Item in this

    • swapItems

      void swapItems(int slot1, int slot2)
      Swaps the Items in 2 slots of this.
      Parameters:
      slot1 - the first slot
      slot2 - the second slot

    • swapItems

      void swapItems(Inventory src, int srcSlot, int destSlot)
      Swaps Items between slots in 2 Inventories.
      Parameters:
      src - the Inventory to swap Items with
      srcSlot - the slot in src
      destSlot - the slot in this

    • transferItem

      void transferItem(Inventory src, int srcSlot, int destSlot)
      Transfers an Item from another Inventory to this.
      Parameters:
      src - the Inventory to transfer from
      srcSlot - the slot in src to transfer from
      destSlot - the slot in this to place the Item at

    • splitItem

      void splitItem(Inventory src, int srcSlot, int destSlot, int count)
      Moves some of the Items at srcSlot to the unoccupied slot destSlot.
      Parameters:
      src - the Inventory to transfer from
      srcSlot - the slot in this to take from
      destSlot - the slot in this to place at
      count - the number of Items to move

    • nextPlacement

      int nextPlacement(Inventory.Item item, int maxStack)
      Returns position of the first slot in this at which item could be added to this, or -1 if no such slot exists. The method will attempt to stack Items before placing in an empty slot.
      Parameters:
      item - the item to be placed
      maxStack - the maximum stack size desired, or 0 if you want unbounded stacking
      Returns:
      the index of the first such slot, or -1 if there are none

    • useItem

      String useItem(int slot)
      Removes a single Item at slot slot in this.
      Parameters:
      slot - the slot at which to use the Item
      Returns:
      the name of the used Item

    • isAt

      boolean isAt(int slot, String name)
      Checks whether an Item with name name is at slot in this.
      Parameters:
      slot - the slot to check
      name - the name of the Item to check for
      Returns:
      true if the Item at slot has the correct name, and false otherwise
